pullRequest.title: [Exam] Code-Editor Bugfixes
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.

Motivation and Context
Notes from Test Session:

 On Startup, the Submission's isSynced flag was set to false. We use true at the start of the conduction.
 Worker Issue: Refused to create a worker from '...' because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive...

 Results of a submission were loaded into the wrong exercise. Possible fix in: 1629656
 When you push your changes locally and afterwards press "refresh files" in the online code editor, the wrong exercise files are loaded Possible fix in: 1629656
 TypeError: this.fileSession[this.selectedFile] is undefined (refresh files)


Description

Set the isSynced to true and submitted to false for the initial ProgrammingSubmission.
Track the submitted status using the onCommitStateChange event.
Add additional guards against undefined, see point 5 above.
Fix navigation issue from 1629656 solved point 3 & 4 above.
Every component now has its own service, thereby effectively eliminating the potential overlaps.

Steps for Testing

Log in to Artemis
Create an exam with multiple programming exercises.
Open the console & check the network tab.
Interact with the exam, switch between exercises, create submissions, edit files etc.
All exercises should load correctly, and the correct id should be displayed in the console.
No errors should be seen in the console & network tab

Screenshots

commit.message: Show isSynced exercise status when first opening the exam

code refactoring
Remove double check for submission error
Do not rethrow error after handle
test approach
fix typescript warnings
Use new instances of domain dependent services for each ExamCodeEditor
Merge branch 'develop' into bugfix/code-editor/bulletproofing
Do not lookup an undifined filename
check for undefined fileSession
Merge branch 'bugfix/code-editor/bulletproofing' of github.com:ls1intum/Artemis into bugfix/code-editor/bulletproofing
Merge branch 'develop' into bugfix/code-editor/bulletproofing
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/develop' into bugfix/code-editor/bulletproofing
Merge branch 'bugfix/code-editor/bulletproofing' of https://github.com/ls1intum/Artemis into bugfix/code-editor/bulletproofing
Merge branch 'develop' into bugfix/code-editor/bulletproofing

Revert "test approach"

This reverts commit c7f856788ea6597110d0b61aed7737d93ac8842d.
fix typescript warning
set the submitted flag after successful commit
Add a check for undefined lookup
Merge branch 'bugfix/code-editor/bulletproofing' of github.com:ls1intum/Artemis into bugfix/code-editor/bulletproofing
Update the isSynced and submitted flag after commit

nodes.bodyText: I would suggest to remove it if it is not needed anymore instead of commenting it out.
Not added in this PR, but I would suggest to remove/refactor this comment as I have no clue what session this is about.

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    console.log(`Constructor DomainDependentService (${this.constructor.name}) with id ${this.componentId}`);

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    console.log(`Destroy DomainDependentService (${this.constructor.toString()}) with id ${this.componentId}`);

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    console.log(`Constructor Service with id ${this.componentId}`);

commit.message: Remove logging
add guard against undefined
Merge branch 'bugfix/code-editor/bulletproofing' of github.com:ls1intum/Artemis into bugfix/code-editor/bulletproofing

nodes.bodyText: I did not know this was possible. Cool solution! 😎
